title: Black voters in Virginia refuse to be blamed for a major Democratic defeat.
summary: Black state leaders and voters said the results were a sign that the party could not rely on minority voters to cover its cratering totals in white areas of the state.

title: Eric Adams's Style: ‘Everything About You Must Say Power’
summary: New York City’s new mayor, Eric Adams, pays a lot of attention to what he wears. You should, too.

title: What Youngkin's Win in the Virginia Governor Race Means for Democrats
summary: Less than a year after taking power in Washington, the party faces a grim immediate future, struggling to energize voters without a presidential foil and losing messaging wars to Republicans.

title: Eric Adams Is Elected Mayor of New York City
summary: Mr. Adams, a Democrat and former police captain, will be the second Black mayor in the city’s history.

title: Holocaust Scholar to Testify at Charlottesville Trial
summary: In a Charlottesville courtroom, Deborah E. Lipstadt will testify to the persistence of antisemitism, and its links to present-day politics.

title: C.D.C. Recommends Covid Vaccine for Younger Children
summary: With the agency director’s sign-off, children ages 5 to 11 could begin to receive the shots this week.

title: Supreme Court Hears Free Speech Case on Politician’s Censure
summary: The justices seemed inclined to find a narrow way to reject the argument that the censure of an elected official in Houston ran afoul of the First Amendment.

title: Democrats Push for Agreement on Tax Deduction That Benefits the Rich
summary: Lawmakers are coalescing around a deal to suspend a $10,000 cap on state and local tax deductions that was imposed during the Trump administration.

title: Military Grants Few Coronavirus Vaccine Exemptions as Deadlines Loom
summary: The majority of active-duty troops have gotten a mandatory coronavirus vaccine ahead of deadline, with religious-based exemptions largely dismissed.

title: Biden Tries to Reassert American Leadership, and His Own
summary: President Biden hoped his personal style of politicking could help him build global consensus on fighting climate change. But as he has learned in Washington, charm offensives have their limits.

title: Travelers by Land Should Ready Documents, U.S. Officials Say
summary: The reopening comes just ahead of the holiday season, clearing the way for tourists and other nonessential travelers after about 19 months of border closures

title: Democrats Reach Deal to Control Drug Prices in Bill
summary: The provision would, for the first time, allow the government to negotiate prices for some medicines covered by Medicare.

title: Democrats Work to Salvage Methane Fee Amid Opposition From Manchin
summary: Senator Joe Manchin III of West Virginia, a Democratic holdout, is still working to weaken or jettison a proposed fee on emissions of methane, a powerful pollutant.

title: Prominent Conservatives Back Letting States Limit Guns in Public
summary: A brief filed in a major gun control case to be heard on Wednesday by the Supreme Court argued that limits on the public carrying of weapons were consistent with the Second Amendment.

title: Fed Expected to Announce Plan to Slow Bond Buying Amid Rapid Inflation
summary: The Federal Reserve is expected to announce a plan to taper off its bond buying. With inflation surging, economists’ eyes are already turning to rates.

title: Justice Dept. Sues Penguin Random House Over Simon & Schuster Deal
summary: The Biden administration’s rejection of the proposed $2.18 billion publishing merger reflects a changing atmosphere in Washington toward consolidation.

title: Biden Administration Moves to Limit Methane, a Potent Greenhouse Gas
summary: The new rule was announced at a U.N. summit where the United States is facing skepticism about its commitment to climate change.

title: Races to Watch on Election Day
summary: The Virginia governor’s race will be closely studied for clues about the midterms, and new mayors will be chosen in New York, Boston, Buffalo, Atlanta and more.

title: At COP26 Summit, Urgent Pleas to Combat Global Warning
summary: The opening day of a climate summit was heavy on dire warnings and light on substantive proposals as leaders in Glasgow met to discuss a warming world.

title: Linwood Holton, 98,Virginia Governor Who Pushed for Racial Equality, Dies
summary: The first Republican governor of the state in almost a century, he seemed to herald a new, post-racial South. He later became disillusioned with his own party.
